text.__SUMMARY__: Caridina serratirostris is a species of freshwater shrimp that lives in the Indo-west Pacific region, from Madagascar to Fiji, including northern Queensland the ones found in Australia are a different ssp. Its common name in the aquarium trade, "ninja shrimp", comes from its ability to quickly change colour and disappear into its surroundings like a ninja. Adults grow to a length of 25–35 millimetres (1.0–1.4 in).
text.External links: De Grave, S., et al. 2013. Caridina serratirostris. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2013. Downloaded on 14 June 2016.
